intro: Hieracium subdentatum, commonly known as the lesser spear-thistle, is a perennial flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads composed of numerous small florets. The plant typically grows to a height of 30–100 cm, with hairy, ribbed stems and alternate, heart-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and appear in late summer, producing seeds that are dispersed by wind. It thrives in disturbed soils and is often found in meadows, roadsides, and waste areas.
